alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Caledonia, southwestern Essex and northeastern Washington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Danville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Waterford, Lyndonville Village, Kirby, Barnet, Concord, Peacham, Danville, Lower Waterford, Cabot, Burke, Walden, Victory, Groton, Ryegate, Wheelock, St. Johnsbury Center, Concord Corner, and West Waterford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 120 and 140. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northeastern Vermont.
